framework_intro.para: Below is a suggested framework to help you structure your résumé if you are applying for your first job. There are spaces for you to add the content of your résumé.
Remember that you can look the word up in the Oxford Advanced Learner's Dictionary.

commentary.para: A résumé is a summary of the information in your CV that matches the job you are applying for. It gives information about your education, qualifications, skills and work experience. It should be no more than one page.
It is advisable to check with a teacher or tutor if there are any special conventions you should use.
Also look at the covering/cover letter.
Below is the framework that was used to create this résumé.
Provide your college or temporary address if you have one, as well as your permanent address.
There is no need to mention your age, gender, nationality, race, religion or marital status. Don't send a photo unless you are asked to.
Summarize your goals and customize your résumé for specific positions. Your objective should be stated in terms of a realistic short-term goal and/or a job for which you are currently qualified.
Your profile gives an employer an idea of who you are.
These are shown in reverse order and do not include information about elementary school.
You should try to include American equivalents of your qualifications.
This is also shown in reverse order, beginning with the most recent. As this is the résumé of a recent graduate it includes holiday and part-time work.
These are the practical abilities of the applicant. The section also includes any formal qualifications relating to these skills.
This is a short section. It includes things like sport, creative activities and community activities, but not vague subjects such as 'reading' or 'travel'.

checklist.point: Collect together all the information you need to include in your résumé
Select information that is relevant to the job you are applying for
Make sure all the information is accurate
Use action verbs and adjectives to present yourself positively.
Use appropriate vocabulary to describe your skills and experience.
Organize the information into the framework.
Show Education and Work experience in reverse order, beginning with the most recent.
Use either full sentences (e.g. I taught French at a summer school) or note form (Taught French at summer school).
Describe your work experience in terms of self-motivation, teamwork, organization, problem-solving, and enthusiasm.
Have I kept my résumé short? (for new graduates not more than one page)
Have I used capitals, bold type, spacing and underlining to make my résumé attractive and easy to read?
Have I used a typeface such as Times New Roman, Arial or Verdana in at least 10 pt?
Have I used the standard US paper size of 216 x 279mm?
Have I used reasonable margins on the page?
Have I used US spelling and punctuation?
Have I asked someone to read and edit the résumé for me?

paragraph.name: Personal information
paragraph.tip: TIP Provide your college or temporary address if you have one, as well as your permanent address. There is no need to mention your age, gender, nationality, race, religion or marital status. Don't send a photo unless you are asked to.

paragraph.name: Objective
paragraph.tip: TIP Summarize your goals and customize your résumé for specific positions. Your objective should be stated in terms of a realistic short-term goal and/or a job for which you are currently qualified.

content.para: To obtain an entry-level management position within an international hospitality organization.

paragraph.name: Profile
paragraph.tip: TIP You should include this section to give an employer an idea of who you are.

content.para: An outgoing and articulate post-graduate with experience in the travel business and children’s summer camps

paragraph.name: Education
paragraph.desc: Education and qualifications are put in reverse order.
paragraph.tip: TIP Omit details of your elementary school. Try to give American equivalents of your qualifications. Experienced candidates: List your key qualifications, but do not include every exam result or grade.

content.prompt: Type details of your education here
content.para: Northern Arizona University, Flagstaff, Arizona, USA

paragraph.name: Experience
paragraph.desc: This is also in reverse order, beginning with the most recent.
paragraph.tip: TIP If you are a new graduate, include any holiday or part-time work. Experienced candidates: Put this section before your education. Give more information about the most recent post. Begin each job with the title and responsibilities and follow with your achievements. It is not usual to include details of your salary.

content.prompt: Type details of your experience here
content.para: Kokopelli Extreme Tours, Sedona, Arizona, USA
Organized adventure package tours for large student groups, trained and supervised new staff members, and maintained partner relationships.
Acted as a group leader for children aged 10-15, developed curriculum for campers, and led overnight hiking trips into the nearby wilderness.

paragraph.name: Honors
paragraph.desc: Any prizes and awards that you have won.

content.prompt: Type details of your honors here
content.para: Agent of the Month, Kokopelli Extreme Tours, March 2008

paragraph.name: Skills
paragraph.tip: TIP Include any exams you have passed or qualifications you have gained. Experienced candidates: You can make more of this section and include organizational, computer, social, and any other appropriate skills in separate sections.

content.prompt: Type details of your skills here
content.para: Fluent in French and English; conversational Spanish

paragraph.name: Interests
paragraph.tip: TIP Keep this short. Include a sport, a creative activity and a community activity, if you can. Avoid vague subjects such as reading or travel (unless you have done some serious travel for fairly long periods of time).

content.prompt: Type details of your interests here
content.para: Enjoy web design in HTML and Flash

paragraph.name: References
paragraph.desc: Give the names and addresses on a separate page when you send your résumé .
